sentences.english: The enchanted young listeners in Central Park are proof of that.
sentences.chinese: 在中央公園心醉神迷的小聽衆就是最好的證明。

sentences.english: All she knew was a thrill of ecstasy that Cal Barton desired her!
sentences.chinese: 她只知道卡巴頓對她的慾望，這使她喜悅得心醉。

sentences.english: Infatuated with your grace, every smile is glorious.
sentences.chinese: 迷戀你的優雅，每一次微笑都令人心醉。

sentences.english: I have never seen such spellbinding flowers in the park .
sentences.chinese: 我從未在公園裏看到過如此令人心醉神迷的鮮花。

sentences.english: How pleasant thy banks and green valleys below.
sentences.chinese: 你的堤岸與青翠的河谷是多麼令人心醉。

sentences.english: The affliction of two women and love are hated, heartbreak letting a person however also be charmed.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女人的苦難與愛恨，讓人心碎卻也心醉。

sentences.english: Even when those flowers were taken away, the smell lingered about most pleasantly.
sentences.chinese: 雖然花已拿走，但其餘香裊繞，讓人心醉。

sentences.english: I was enchanted with the sweet music.
sentences.chinese: 這美妙的音樂使我心醉。

sentences.english: She fell in love with him, to the yellow bull.
sentences.chinese: 她心醉了，爲這頭傲氣的黃色公牛而傾心。

sentences.english: Get enchanted by this spellbinding top.
sentences.chinese: 得到這個引人入勝的頂部心醉。

sentences.english: I have never seen such spellbinding flowers in the park.
sentences.chinese: 我記得非常清楚，公園裏的鮮花從未令我心醉神迷過。

sentences.english: Do other people feel fascinated, sleepless night.
sentences.chinese: 也是那樣另人心醉，徹夜無眠。

sentences.english: Not long ago, in a charming dream.
sentences.chinese: 前不久，於一個令人心醉的美夢。

sentences.english: Carrots are more corrupting than sticks .
sentences.chinese: 胡蘿蔔比大棒更令人心醉。
他們從不感到歡樂，但經常心醉神迷。

sentences.english: Smile floating on the lemonade, soft and smooth. How I was? amazed.
sentences.chinese: 笑容淌於檸檬汁之間，又滑又軟，令人心醉。

definition: one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
